column4: Im running 11.04 how do I hook up my laptop to my TV via hdmi? Cable is already hooked up, I just can't get my screen to pop up on my TV
okay lemme look into it.
its true name is gnome-display-properties
there is a monitors application which is a gui to xrandr
have you tried hitting the function button to enable the output display, maybe the hardware requires that you do that
function button?
and gnome-display-properties/xrandr isn't showing the other screen
nope
what kind of graphics card is this
i understand that nvidia doesn't use xrandr... we've been going at this all wrong
i think you need to use whatever the nvidia screen resolution control application is
okay
i'm not sure we can help much there. it is an nvidia driver
how can I tell if I have the correct nvidia driver?
its not that you don't have the right driver, its that we can't really support that because nobody knows what that driver does

if you have nvidia-current then you have the nvidia driver. there are a couple alternatives including a plain 2d driver, and a very new reverse-engineered driver called nouveau. i've avoided nvidia for years now so I don't know what works and what doesnt
netbook remix got folded into the main os
sudo -i is prefered over sudo su
it would be /home/username/Desktop/whatever
if they specify a directory in $HOME that doesn't exist then just create it

there are multiple ways you could do this. if you put it in /usr/share/themes then the files need to be owned by root:root and you do everything with sudo/gksudo. then anyone can use that theme. or if its just for yourself then $HOME/.themes or $HOME/.icons (whatever it is) would be more appropriate
I guess I dont understand what you mean. Just tell me how to extract this 7z file into the themes folder
to copy a file as root "sudo cp sourcefile destinationfile"
i would discourage doing that but the gui filemanager is called "nautilus"
